title: Highest Density of Commercial Bank Branches
description: In 2023, San Marino boasted 122.01 commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults, the highest density globally.

title: Rapid Growth in Household Consumption Expenditure
description: In 2022, San Marino experienced a 15.56% growth in household and NPISHs final consumption expenditure, indicating a robust economic activity.

title: Significant Increase in Per Capita Consumption
description: San Marino saw a 17.26% rise in per capita household consumption expenditure in 2022, showcasing strong consumer confidence.

title: High Investment in Health by Government
description: In 2022, 29.51% of San Marino's general government expenditure was dedicated to health, reflecting a strong commitment to public health.

title: Exceptional Male Survival Rate to Age 65
description: In 2022, 93.95% of males in San Marino survived to age 65, one of the highest rates globally, indicating excellent healthcare and living conditions.

title: High Proportion of Middle-Aged Males
description: In 2023, males aged 50-54 constituted 8.91% of the male population, while those aged 55-59 made up 9.08%, reflecting an aging male demographic.

title: Lowest Agricultural Contribution to GDP
description: In 2022, the agriculture, forestry, and fishing sectors contributed only 0.011% to San Marino's GDP, highlighting its minimal role in the country's economy.

title: Smallest Rural Population
description: As of 2023, San Marino had a rural population of just 733 people, reflecting its highly urbanized nature.

title: Lowest Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Secondary Education
description: In 2018, San Marino had a pupil-teacher ratio of 5.84 in secondary education, indicating a favorable student-to-teacher interaction.

title: Minimal Infant Mortality Rate
description: In 2023, San Marino recorded an infant mortality rate of 1.4 per 1,000 live births, one of the lowest globally.

title: Lowest Probability of Child Mortality
description: The probability of dying among children aged 5-9 years was just 0.2 per 1,000 in 2023, showcasing San Marino's effective healthcare system.

title: Minimal Under-Five Mortality Rate
description: San Marino's under-five mortality rate was 1.4 per 1,000 live births in 2023, reflecting excellent child healthcare services.

title: High Female Teacher Training in Upper Secondary Education
description: In 2023, 5.81% of female teachers in upper secondary education were trained, indicating room for improvement in teacher training programs.
